Context:
* The text discusses careers in working with the Deaf and deafblind, specifically becoming a professional Interpreter or Deafblind Intervenor.
* There is a one-year American Sign Language certificate program offered by the college to introduce students to the language and culture of the Deaf community, preparing them for further advanced studies.
* 4th-year students offer limited pro bono interpreting services through the Volunteer Student Interpreting Services (VSIS) program.
* The college provides a free Entry Advising service to help match skills, background, and career goals with program options.
* Information sessions are available for learning more about the programs and having questions answered by faculty and staff.
* Tours can be arranged to visit classrooms, labs, and facilities, giving an idea of student life at George Brown College.
* Contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
* Social media hub is also available for more information.
* Application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more can be received by signing up on the website.
* The college's website contains information that is subject to change without notice.
* George Brown College fee requirements should be verified by students.
